ARABIC: تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ ٱلْجِبَالُ هَدًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The heavens are all but rent apart and the earth split open and the mountains brought crashing down,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Which would cleave the skies asunder, rend the earth, and split the mountains,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well-nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This would almost cause the heavens to rent apart, the earth to cleave asunder and the mountains to crumble down in fragments,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The heavens are close to being torn apart by it, and the earth being split asunder, and the mountains succumbing and falling down.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains Hadda.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The heavens may almost be rent thereat, and the earth cleave asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The heavens are wellnigh rent of it and the earth split asunder, and the mountains wellnigh fall down crashing for
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the heavens might well-nigh burst thereat, and the earth break asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Well-nigh the heavens are rent thereat and the earth cleft in sunder and the mountains fall down in pieces. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The heavens are about to be rent apart at it, the earth to split open, and the mountains to collapse into bits,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains fall in ruins,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Thereby the heavens are nearly torn and the earth split asunder, and mountains fall crashing down
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: At which the heavens almost rupture, and the earth splits, and the mountains fall and crumble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:90] The heavens are almost (read takādu, or yakādu) rent (read takādu tatafattarna), by being torn apart (a variant reading has yanfatirna), because of it and the earth [is almost] split asunder, and the mountains [almost] fall down crashing, collapsing on top of them, because of [the fact]:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Whereby almost the heavens are torn) crack, (and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins),
